mapper.sql: id, permission_code, permission_name, parent_permission_code, url, icon, hide, lev, sort, create_time, create_by
mapper.update:
update sys_permission
permission_code = #{permissionCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
permission_name = #{permissionName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
parent_permission_code = #{parentPermissionCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
url = #{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
icon = #{icon,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
lev = #{lev,jdbcType=INTEGER}
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select p.id, p.permission_code, p.permission_name, p.parent_permission_code, p.url, p.icon, p.hide, p.lev, p.sort, p.create_time, p.create_by from sys_permission p order by p.sort asc

select p.id, p.permission_code, p.permission_name, p.parent_permission_code, p.url, p.icon, p.hide, p.lev, p.sort, p.create_time, p.create_by from sys_permission p inner join sys_role_permission rp on rp.permission_id = p.id inner join sys_user_role ur on ur.role_id = rp.role_id where ur.user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR} order by p.sort asc

select p.id, p.permission_code, p.permission_name, p.parent_permission_code, pr.permission_name as parentPermissionName, p.url, p.icon, p.hide, p.lev, p.sort, p.create_time, u.real_name as createUserRealName from sys_permission p left join sys_user u on u.id = p.create_by left join sys_permission pr on pr.permission_code = p.parent_permission_code
and p.permission_code=#{permissionCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
and p.permission_name like '%'||#{permissionName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}||'%'
and p.url like '%'||#{url,jdbcType=VARCHAR}||'%'
order by p.sort asc
